fields.name: Autoplay
fields.instructions: Autoplay the slideshow.

fields.name: Autoplay Timer
fields.instructions: Set the delay in seconds for how long to stay on each slide. You can use one decimal, for example 2.5. If set to 0, it will default to 4 seconds.

fields.name: Background Attachment
fields.instructions: Set the background attachment.

fields.name: Background Color
fields.instructions: Override the page background color.

fields.name: Background Image
fields.instructions: Set a background image.

fields.name: Background Position
fields.instructions: Set the positioning of the background.

fields.name: Background Repeat
fields.instructions: Set the background repeat.

fields.name: Background Size
fields.instructions: Set the background sizing.

fields.name: Bleed
fields.instructions: Set the image, slideshow or video to bleed off either one or both edges of the viewport. Be careful using this on pieces that are not at either edge.

fields.name: Blend Mode
fields.instructions: Set the blending mode of the block.

fields.name: Channel
fields.instructions: Select the channel to pull in.

fields.name: Classes
fields.instructions: Add additional classes to the item's main div.

fields.name: Custom Code
fields.instructions: Enter custom html, css or javascript.

fields.name: Custom CSS
fields.instructions: Upload and select custom css files.

fields.name: Custom Fonts
fields.instructions: Custom fonts should be following @font-face standards (woff and woff2 are good and modern formats—try https://transfonter.org/). Upload the font files, and the accompanying font.css, then select the font.css to load the fonts in the frontend.

fields.name: Default Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`). For example, the default if left blank is: `"Helvetica Neue", Arial, sans-serif`.

fields.name: Default Font Line Height
fields.instructions: Enter a numeric value (with two decimals if you like). The default is `1.5`. If left at `0`, the default is applied.

fields.name: Default Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: Display
fields.instructions: Choose how to render the structure.

fields.name: Display 1 Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`).

fields.name: Display 1 Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: Display 2 Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`).

fields.name: Display 2 Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: Display 3 Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`).

fields.name: Display 3 Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: Display 4 Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`).

fields.name: Display 4 Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: Entries
fields.instructions: Add the entries you want to show up on this post.

fields.name: Entry
fields.instructions: Select the entry you wish to use for the thumbnail.

fields.name: Favicon
fields.instructions: You can technically set favicons for each and every size to correspond with iOS device homescreens and so forth—however, the lazy, but smart approach is to accomodate most devices with one size. 152x152px. Upload your favicon image here, ideally a 152x152px png.

fields.name: Google Analytics Code Snippet
fields.instructions: Paste your Google Analytics code snippet here, including the `<script></script>` tags.

fields.name: Grid
fields.instructions: Set the grid item width. The grid has 12 columns, use them wisely.

fields.name: Grid Gutter Width
fields.instructions: Set the grid gutter width for the whole site. Enter any standard CSS value like 1%, 20px, 20em and 3rem, 2vw or 2vh. It's important to define the number and the unit without spaces.

fields.name: H1 Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`).

fields.name: H1 Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: H2 Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`).

fields.name: H2 Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: H3 Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`).

fields.name: H3 Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: H4 Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`).

fields.name: H4 Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: H5 Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`).

fields.name: H5 Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: H6 Font
fields.instructions: Paste or enter your font family override using CSS standards (excluding `font-family:`).

fields.name: H6 Font Size
fields.instructions: Enter standard CSS values only—for example `16px`, `1rem` or other font sizing units that are CSS standard.

fields.name: Header Autohide
fields.instructions: Hide the header automatically when the user scrolls down (it reappears when the user scrolls up or hits the bottom of the page). Only works for fixed navigation.

fields.name: Header Fixed
fields.instructions: Keeps the header at the top of the window when scrolling.

fields.name: Header Line Height
fields.instructions: Enter a numeric value (with one decimal if you like) for H1, H2, H3, H4, H5 and H6. The default is `1.1`. If left at `0`, the default is applied.

fields.name: Height
fields.instructions: Enter any standard CSS value like 50%, 20px, 20em and 3rem, 10vw or 20vh. It's important to define the number and the unit without spaces.

fields.name: Indicator
fields.instructions: Select the slideshow indicator type.

fields.name: Layer
fields.instructions: Layer the item on top or below other content that is pulled on top/below.

fields.name: Limit
fields.instructions: Limit the number of entries to pull in from the selected structure.

fields.name: Link Color
fields.instructions: Override link color.

fields.name: Link Hover Color
fields.instructions: Override link hover color.

fields.name: Logo
fields.instructions: Upload your logo to go in the header instead of the site name. It's best to use an SVG. Make sure it is white, it will be the negative of whatever is behind.

fields.name: Main Menu
fields.instructions: Here you add links to entries or custom URLs to the main menu.

new1.name: Entry
new1.instructions: Select the entry you wish to link to.

new2.name: Override Name
new2.instructions: You can override the name that shows up in the menu.

new2.name: Name
new2.instructions: Set the name that shows up in the menu.

fields.name: Margin
fields.instructions: Set the site's margin(s). Enter any standard CSS value like 3%, 40px, 30em and 30rem, 10vw or 20vh. It's important to define the number and the unit without spaces.

fields.name: Max Height
fields.instructions: Set the slideshow maximum height.

fields.name: Menu Background Color
fields.instructions: Set the background color of the menu.

fields.name: Menu Link Color
fields.instructions: Set the menu link color.

fields.name: Menu Link Hover Color
fields.instructions: Set the menu link hover color.

fields.name: Menu Text Color
fields.instructions: Set the menu text color.

fields.name: Menu Toggle Type
fields.instructions: Even if you set the navigation type to show as items in the header, it will responsively fall back to this option on smaller viewports.

fields.name: Navigation Type
fields.instructions: Choose how to show your navigation items in the header.

fields.name: Next and Previous Links in Work Entries
No Padding
fields.instructions: Removes half the gutter on the sides of the grid item.

fields.name: Not Fluid Width
fields.instructions: Set the row to not be fluid width, meaning not filling the viewport past a certain resolution.

fields.name: Offset
fields.instructions: Set the grid offset from the left.

fields.name: Overlay Match Alignment
fields.instructions: Force the child blocks of the overlay to inherit the overlay alignment (for middle and bottom alignment).

fields.name: Page Loader
fields.instructions: Use page loader for when navigating the site. This isn't necessary, but can briefly stimulate the impatient crowd.

fields.name: Pull
fields.instructions: Floats the content either left or right. Does not work in masonry rows.

fields.name: Pull Up Below
fields.instructions: Works like top-aligned, but pulls content below up to start immediately after the row.

fields.name: Shadow
fields.instructions: Adds a drop shadow to the image or video.

fields.name: Show Arrows
fields.instructions: Show the navigation arrows.

fields.name: Site Background Size
fields.instructions: Set the site background size.

fields.name: Slide Objects Into View
fields.instructions: Slide images, texts, videos and everything else into view as you scroll up and down. A very nice and subtle effect.

fields.name: Slideshow Type
fields.instructions: Set the slideshow type.

fields.name: Structure
fields.instructions: Select the structure to pull in.

fields.name: Style
fields.instructions: Add style attributes to the item's main div.

fields.name: Sub Menu
fields.instructions: Here you add links to entries or custom URLs to the main menu.

new1.name: Entry
new1.instructions: Select the entry you wish to link to.

new2.name: Override Name
new2.instructions: You can override the name that shows up in the menu.

new2.name: Name
new2.instructions: Set the name that shows up in the menu.

new3.name: Open Link in a New Window

fields.name: Text Color
fields.instructions: Override page text color

fields.name: Thumbnail Hover Overlay Color
fields.instructions: Set the color and transparency of the overlay that appears when you hover over or tap thumbnails.

fields.name: Thumbnail Text Position
fields.instructions: Set the position of the text that goes together with thumbnails.

fields.name: Thumbnail Text Size
fields.instructions: Set the thumbnail text size.

fields.name: Top Aligned
fields.instructions: This will make the content start at the top of the viewport.

fields.name: Vertical Align
fields.instructions: Set the vertical alignment of the content. Note that the vertical alignment is based off of the tallest block, meaning everything within the overlay block is top aligned.

fields.name: Web Font Snippets
fields.instructions: Add your external web font code snippets here. These are css stylesheet links and need to follow @font-face standards.

fields.name: Channel Post Content
fields.instructions: This is where you build your channel entry, which is a lot more basic than a page, as it's more akin to a blog post.

fields.name: Post Content
fields.instructions: This is where you build your page or entry. You have to add at least one row—which can house as many blocks as you want. You can also split up the content nicely with more rows.

relabel.name: Background Image
relabel.instructions: Set a background image for the row.
This will be your slide image. If you add video (below), this will be the video poster. The aspect ratio of the video should be the same aspect ratio as the image.
This is your poster/fallback. Without it, the video loop will not work.

relabel.name: Background Image
relabel.instructions: Set a background image for the site.
